DOC.brief_summary: This study will assess the effect of RO4607381, compared to placebo, on atherosclerotic plaque in patients with coronary heart disease (CHD) including patients with other CHD risk factors. After a pre-randomisation period during which positron emission tomography computed tomography (PET/CT) and MRI will be conducted, patients will be randomized to receive either RO4607381 600mg po daily, or placebo po daily. PET/CT and MRI scans will be taken at intervals during the study. The anticipated time on study treatment is 2 years, and the target sample size is 100 individuals.
DOC.brief_title: A Study of the Effect of RO4607381 on Atherosclerotic Plaque in Patients With Coronary Heart Disease
DOC.criteria: adult patients, 1875 years of age; CHD, including patients with other CHD risk factors; treated appropriately for dyslipidemia; clinically stable. previous exposure to any cholesteryl ester transfer protein (CETP) inhibitor or vaccine; recent (within 3 months) clinically significant coronary events, transient ischemic attacks or cerebrovascular accident; severe anemia; uncontrolled hypertension; poorly controlled diabetes.
